quote: All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf, A Room of One's Own

quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what's for lunch
author: Orson Welles

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde, A Woman of No Importance

quote: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food
author: George Bernard Shaw, Man and Superman

quote: Popcorn for breakfast! Why not? It's a grain. It's like, like, grits, but with high self-esteem.
author: James Patterson, The Angel Experiment

quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields

quote: A fit, healthy body — that is the best fashion statement
author: Jess C Scott

quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Cakes are healthy too, you just eat a small slice.
author: Mary Berry

quote: Probably one of the most private things in the world is an egg before it is broken.
author: M.F.K. Fisher

quote: Humor keeps us alive. Humor and food. Don't forget food. You can go a week without laughing.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook.
author: Julia Child

quote: You are what what you eat eats
author: Michael Pollan, In Defense of Food: An Eater's Manifesto

quote: I am a better person when I have less on my plate.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

quote: Am I tough? Am I strong? Am I hard-core? Absolutely. Did I whimper with pathetic delight when I sank my teeth into my hot fried-chicken sandwich? You betcha.
author: James Patterson

quote: Wait. Why am I thinking about Krispy Kremes? We're supposed to be exercising.
author: Meg Cabot, Big Boned

quote: Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only real stumbling block is fear of failure. In cooking you've got to have a what-the-hell attitude.
author: Julia Child

quote: Don't wreck a sublime chocolate experience by feeling guilty. Chocolate isn't like premarital sex. It will not make you pregnant. And it always feels good.
author: Lora Brody

quote: Ice-cream is exquisite. What a pity it isn't illegal.
author: Voltaire

quote: I am not a glutton - I am an explorer of food
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: How can you govern a country which has 246 varieties of cheese?
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too. And you've got to talk about it to somebody who understands that kind of food.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, Jailbird

quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
author: Calvin Trillin

quote: He showed the words “chocolate cake” to a group of Americans and recorded their word associations. “Guilt” was the top response. If that strikes you as unexceptional, consider the response of French eaters to the same prompt: “celebration
author: Michael Pollan, In Defense of Food: An Eater's Manifesto

quote: Anything is good if it's made of chocolate.
author: Jo Brand

quote: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Give a man a fish, and you'll feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and he'll buy a funny hat. Talk to a hungry man about fish, and you're a consultant.
author: Scott Adams

quote: Training is everything. The peach was once a bitter almond; cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I don't know what it is about food your mother makes for you, especially when it's something that anyone can make - pancakes, meat loaf, tuna salad - but it carries a certain taste of memory.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: If you're afraid of butter, use cream.
author: Julia Child

quote: No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, the wisdom of cookbook writers.
author: Laurie Colwin
